meanings.definition: To make a silly mistake or error.
meanings.sent1: I was goofing when I accidentally put salt instead of sugar in the cake batter.
meanings.sent2: She always ends up goofing on her math homework, but she learns from her mistakes.
meanings.sent3: While goofing in the kitchen, I mixed up the salt and sugar for the cookies!
meanings.sent4: I felt like I was goofing my way through the dance routine, but I managed to finish it.
meanings.sent5: The comedian's act was full of goofing around and making hilarious mistakes.

meanings.definition: To engage in playful or silly behavior.
meanings.sent1: The children were goofing around in the playground, laughing and playing tag.
meanings.sent2: During the break, the coworkers enjoyed goofing off and sharing jokes in the office.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was goofing with its tail, chasing it in circles around the yard.
meanings.sent4: The friends spent the afternoon goofing around at the park, enjoying each other's company.
meanings.sent5: The siblings were always goofing about, creating fun memories together.

meanings.definition: To waste time or fool around.
meanings.sent1: Instead of studying, he spent the evening goofing on his phone, scrolling through social media.
meanings.sent2: The students were caught goofing in class instead of paying attention to the lesson.
meanings.sent3: She knew she was goofing when she spent hours rearranging her room instead of doing her chores.
meanings.sent4: The group decided to goof off at the beach, playing games and relaxing under the sun.
meanings.sent5: I caught myself goofing around when I should have been working on my project.
